txt.en: Merry is outside the gate of Isengard.\n\nMerry has agreed to tell you the story of how he and Pippin met Treebeard the Ent.
Merry is outside the gate of Isengard.
Pippin looks at you amiably, but says nothing.
Pippin smokes contentedly, and says nothing.
Merry has agreed to tell you the story of how he and Pippin met Treebeard.
'Pip and I met Treebeard after we escaped from the Orcs. He is an Ent, you know, a shepherd of the forests. I can tell you how we met him, if you like.'
Merry's stomach grumbles, and he smiles at you apologetically
Talk to Merry and hear the story of how he met Treebeard
Talk to Merry outside the gate of Isengard

'Pip and I went to Quickbeam's house after that, but my hunger has quite gotten the best of me and I have lost the mood for story-telling. Perhaps I will tell you of the last march of the Ents after I have eaten. But that is enough for now, I think. Quite a tale, was it not?'
'It is quite a long story, but I will tell it to you if you will listen! These are not the most comfortable surroundings for a bit of story-telling, but I will do the very best I can.'
